title: Keen Newsletter
content:
The site remains, last updated mid 2005; what will become of our poor Commander Keen Newsletter?

title: Re: Keen Newsletter
content:
We have a newsletter? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Keen Newsage
content:
I've had a little web project in the works for a few months with the intention of replacing the Keen Newsletter. Aside from the obvious 'getting a round TUIT', the difficult part is deciding what constitutes news, and how to categorise everything.

Looking at the recent threads here, there are a few things that stand out. But there are also bits and pieces that probably wouldn't interest a wide audience. *shrugs*

The plan is to have two types of content--announcements and articles. It will be similar in style to www.osnews.com, with the main purpose of keeping those who don't visit the PCKF frequently, and non-Keeners, informed about what's going on. With the Keen wiki in action now, the scope can be narrowed down a lot, but the concept is still rather tangled in my head.

title: Re: Keen Newsage
content:
Yeah, I don't think much will become of the original newsletter anymore. It has had its time, I think. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

Similar to Spleen, I have a plan for some kind of news site. Just haven't got around TUIT, either.. It'll be called "Grabbiter" and will use those RSS feeds or whatever they are. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
